intro: Urostachys hippurideus var. montanus, commonly known as the mountain rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine, glandular hairs. Urostachys hippurideus var. montanus is notable for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and its role in alpine ecosystems.
